data.title: Pankaj Kapur Biography
data.meta_description:
Pankaj Kapur is an Indian Actor, Story writer, Screenwriter and Director. He is best known for his role as Musaddi Lal in the Indian TV serial ‘Office Office’ in 2000. Besides television, he has played significantly acclaimed roles in films, along with some of the best directors in India, such as Shyam Benegal's Mandi (1983), Kundan Shah's comedy Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro again in 1983. This was followed by Saeed Akhtar Mirza satirical Mohan Joshi Hazir Ho! (1984), Mrinal Sen's Khandhar (1984), and Vidhu Vinod Chopra's suspense thriller Khamosh in 1985.

As a director, he has ventured in two projects- Film ‘Mausam’ in 2011, and T.v. Serial ‘Mohandas B.A.L.L.B’ that run from 1997 to 1998.  

He has also played the role of Mahatma Gandhi’s second secretary in the 1982 oscar-winning film Gandhi, directed by Richard Attenborough. 

Shahid Kapoor, one of the leading actors in Bollywood, is the son of Pankaj Kapoor with his first wife, Actress and dancer Neelima Azeem. Pankaj Kapoor later got married to Supriya Pathak, another stage and film actress. Together, they have two children, Sanah and Ruhan Kapur.
